qas.question: When did Honda, Toyota and Nissan open US assembly plants?

answers.text: A decade after the 1973 oil crisis

qas.question: Name a larger car that Toyota came up with as buyers lamented the small sized compacts?
Name an extra that was added to the production of the compacts.
Name a luxury division of Toyota.
In 1973 what did Mazda open in the US?
What did Mazda establish in the US in 1973?
What did Mazda want to distinguish itself from by opening assembly plants in 1973?
What did some buyers not like about Acuras?
What are two things that were added to the Lexus in 1981?

context: Some buyers lamented <b7_0>the small size<b7_0/> of the first Japanese compacts, and both Toyota and Nissan (then known as Datsun) introduced larger cars such as the <a1_0><a1_2>Toyota <a1_1><a1_3>Corona Mark II<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, the Toyota Cressida, the Mazda 616 and Datsun 810, which added passenger space and amenities such as <a2_1><a2_2><b8_0>air conditioning<a2_2/><a2_1/>, <a2_0>power steering<b8_0/><a2_0/>, AM-FM radios, and even <a2_3>power windows<a2_3/> and central locking without increasing the price of the vehicle. <a0_0><a0_3>A decade after the 1973<a0_0/> oil crisis<a0_3/>, Honda, Toyota and Nissan, affected by the <a0_1><a0_2><a0_4>1981<a0_4/><a0_2/><a0_1/> voluntary export restraints, opened US <b4_0>assembly plants<b4_0/> and established <b5_0>their luxury divisions<b5_0/> (<a3_3>Acura<a3_3/>, <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_4>Lexus<a3_4/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> and Infiniti, respectively) to distinguish themselves from <b6_0>their mass-market brands<b6_0/>.
